RIF-HEADER.AUTHOR: od@enso-managers.com
RIF-HEADER.COMMENT:
This file contains a small Output Management Resource Directory example showing Applications (Document Processing), Fonts, Images and their relations. The purpose is to manage Applications with their resources. Typical queries are - Select the most appropriate resource depending on the attribute values. - Which resources are needed for an application? - Which applications are using a certain resource?
In terms of RIF, dataDefinitions, specTypes, specRelations, specGroups and references to external binary files are used.
Comments: - When compared to 'Small-ORM-Demo-1', the font attributes are simplified to be BOOLEAN rather than derivatives of BOOLEAN. - Font-2: some attributes are missing - expected: default values according to SPEC-TYPE are shown when reading. - The external binary files shall be stored in the database and made accessible with a URI. - All specTypes are complete and correspond best with the AttributeValues. - Good for Demos, less useful for testing than version 4. - When compared to version 5, the hierarchy titles now are an object, as well. - When compared to version 8, the tool extensions controlling the behaviour of SpecRelations when versioning SpecObjects, are added. - In version 10, the editing of two application attributes has been added. - In version 11, the dataTypes and specTypes have been re-worked - In version 14, the dataTypes and specTypes have been simplified and multi-valued enumerations are used for font attributes.
RIF-HEADER.SOURCE-TOOL-ID: manually written with Oxygene XML Author 13.0
RIF-HEADER.TITLE: Output Management Applications PROD (14)

DATATYPE-DEFINITION-BOOLEAN.DESC: This is a standard boolean type

DATATYPE-DEFINITION-STRING.DESC: This is a standard sting type
This is a standard text type

DATATYPE-DEFINITION-INTEGER.DESC: This is a standard signed integer type
This is a standard short integer type, also called NONNEGATIVE INTEGER

DATATYPE-DEFINITION-REAL.DESC: This is a standard real type
This is a standard real type with two digits

DATATYPE-DEFINITION-DATE.DESC: This is a standard date-time type in ISO Format

DATATYPE-DEFINITION-STRING.DESC: This is a standard e-mail address

DATATYPE-DEFINITION-INTEGER.DESC: This is a value range for attribute Importance

DATATYPE-DEFINITION-ENUMERATION.DESC: Enumerated Values for the lifecycle status, e.g. of an application

SPEC-TYPE.DESC: Type of Relation between Applications and Fonts
Type of Relation between Applications and Images
The actual title text is contained in objects of this type, rather than in the hierarchy node.

SPEC-OBJECT.DESC: Some attributes are omitted and it is expected that the default values of the attribute definitions in the SpecType are shown.

XHTML-CONTENT.rif-xhtml:div: All output management applications with relations to the resoures needed. Please note that specific resource revisions are specified to assure create a fully controlled environment for an application.
All output management applications for our customer Telefun
All output management applications for our own company
All fonts delivered with Microsoft Windows and frequently used by Windows applications.

SPEC-HIERARCHY-ROOT.DESC: Hierarchy Root of DocBridge Applications, e.g. applications per customer
Hierarchy Root of Fonts, e.g. by type or characteristic
